website_summaries.verdict: Exceptional price for a powerful, portable unit. With 1,300 watts, it heats up quickly.
pros: A popular model with a sturdy build by a top manufacturer
cons: Cord is relatively short compared to those on other models

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Fire DANGER. Do not leave unattended. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: This item is dangerous. Beware and be careful. Never leave unattended. Upon my 1st use of this appliance, I placed a half full 6qt. pan of water on to boil. I walked away for a few minutes. My grandson started ring the ship's bell yelling FIRE. Not what I wanted to hear. I returned to find the temp. thermal switch smoking heavily. The base was burning hot, had I not placed on a fire proof surface it could have been disastrous. It' s possible mine was simply defective. But, then again................. I would never recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PeterD

customer_reviews.title: Buy $15 dollar hot plates from wal mart instead
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart should be ashamed to put their name on this product and cause their long time customers to feel they are getting Cuisinart quality. You too Amazon!!! Shame on you both. Bought 12/15/2017 to cook breakfast in mornings. Worked until 10/11/2018. Now they want me to invest in shipping to repair. Will use that money to buy one at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Temporary turned into long term use...
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this as a temporary solution because our electric range went out. That was August and here it is November. It has been used every day. I use a heavy 14" cast iron skillet on in most of the time on it. Yes, it gets hot enough to fry foods. I honestly didn't expect it to have lasted this long and I didn't expect to use it more than a week or so. I like the fact that it has some mass to it. It stays put.
customer_reviews.author: JandN

customer_reviews.title: Some Like It Hot ...
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisinart-in-name-only has problems, and I fear it may be a fire hazzard. I Never leave it unattended. Why? *There is no temperature modulation on my unit (absurdly simply engineering so you know this thing is primitive and not at all worthy of the Cuisinart name); it runs hot, hottest, molten ... there is no medium low or low temperature, therefore, no simmer -- a joke. And the burner top looks rusty dark orange after careful cleaning according to instructions. Bought it 11 months ago with an extended warranty. It's either return it or throw it out. Caveat emptor, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Saultxy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BURNER!!!!!!  CANNING ALL AMERICAN PRESSURE POT
customer_reviews.text: I bought an All American LARGE capacity pressure canner but when it came I realized this was so big it would not fit on my stove top (too tall) so I searched the internet for options and this little gem kept coming back even though it was SOOOOO REASONABLY priced. I thought I would need a more expensive one to hold this HEAVY POT. Well I got it and I am THRILLED because it holds my HUGE pressure canner, hold the heat very well and is just PERFECT! LOVE LOVE LOVE this item and the price is amazing too!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley kelley

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 19 days from date of delivery then refused to turn on
customer_reviews.text: 19 Days into a 3 yr warranty period it died, piece of junk (which I have never said about any Cuisinart product before, and I own a lot of them) - going to fight the return battle (not warranty replace) tomorrow and try another companies product Also, it never achieved the same heat level as a $20 el-cheapo 1100w coil burner from Wallgreens Overall, massively disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Jon Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Please Read! Do Not Purchase!!  Becomes Defective
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to like this product and figured since it was Cuisinart that it would be quality. Well, it looks quality and beyond that it is inconsistent with heat settings (heats up faster at 2 or 3 than 5,) is not meant for everyday use, and has mechanical issues.. We bought two thinking the first purchase was just a glitch, BUT NO! The first one lasted 3 months and the second barely 1 month, Yes ONE month! The heating elements completely failed on both and it is a disappointment. Obviously, there is a consistent mechanical flaw.
customer_reviews.author: chad cowan

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Be Up to Your Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. It took 5 minutes to start to heat up. The dial did not work. I suspect it might have been a return. That happens. Terrible product. Good luck if you buy it. Normally Cuisinart produces good products. Not this time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It did not heat up
customer_reviews.text: I was anxiously waiting for my little burner, but when I tried it, it would not heat up. I plugged and unplugged. The green light came on as soon as the item was plugged but it never even got warm. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great burner for cast iron pans
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so my cast iron pans don't scratch my glass stove top. At full power, the burner gets hot enough to sear meat within 3 minutes. The cast iron burner plate is easy to clean and I don't have to worry about scratches. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control sensor failure in 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Not holding temperature setting while cooking , must adjust temperature setting constantly and keep a close watch to prevent burning or detect lower temperature than setting as food is cooking. This problem relinquishes any further use as a cooking tool . Good for melting gulf wax on low is about it . Another retired piece of junk after 2 months of use . Very disappointing considering cost and name brand .
customer_reviews.author: McFoots

customer_reviews.title: I am a big fan of Cuisinart products so I was very disappointed that it was defective and now it can't be ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have purchased the extended warranty for this. It was used twice and then it stopped working. The indicator light no longer comes on and the burner gets warm but not hot. I am a big fan of Cuisinart products so I was very disappointed that it was defective and now it can't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 years of OCCASSIONAL use only!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this burner from amazon in Oct of 2017 and as of today, Sept 2019 burner no longer works. Was only used occasionally not daily so I feel it should have lasted much longer especially considering the price I paid for the CUISINART name thinking " you get what you pay for" Right???.....Apparently NOT.!! Better off buying a cheap electric burner ...if it dies after 2 years its much easier to accept!! Shame on CUISINART for even selling this POC!
customer_reviews.author: cmaynard

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom because her stove was not working properly. It was a complete waste of money. It takes so long to heat up, once it reaches the maximum temperature it turns off, so cooking takes twice as long and you're better off just not using it at all. Another complaint is that there is plastic on the sides of the burner to keep it from moving around. Every time we use the burner, I have noticed that the plastic is melting away. This product can not even boil water quickly, you are better off buying something cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control is way too hot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these units and after using them for a month, I've never needed to use the 2 through 5 settings... on the number 1 setting, they will boil a gallon of water. They will burn food at the 1 setting as well. The warranty has me spending $10 each to replace them. I don't want or trust these anymore. They are a fire and a safety hazard. Looks like I just wasted $100.
customer_reviews.author: neil hunt

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Hot plate
customer_reviews.text: We were without a stove for 2 months due to manufacturer of new stove shipping late. Ordered this counter top hot plate. Is beautiful on the counter, high quality, worked great with whatever pot we used on it from little sauce pans to very large skillets. I could not have been more pleased. You won't regret buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri M.

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: First this is a nice looking hot plate. That said it takesa lot longer than a stovetop to get to maximum temperature. I chose it because of the 1300 watt usage for my 5th wheel in a 30 amp park. It took an hour to make pasta and the water never boiled. Maybe 1300 watts is not enough power.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great single hot plate
customer_reviews.text: I really like this electric hot plate. It heats up nicely. I can boil water in just a few minutes. No problems there. I took off points because it is hard to clean the hot plate when say milk or soup has boiled up and over the pot. I used a Magic Sponge on it, really scrubbing the burned milk or soup, and the black finish was taken off, and now when I use it, it smells like something is burning. I do not know if I can get another heating top, grill? for it. Just watch the pot that you have on it carefully and you may not have the problem that I did.
customer_reviews.author: nachnaabichhoo

customer_reviews.title: GLAD I PURCHASED!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this single burner. I couldn't use my stove for awhile so I needed something to get me and mom by. The only appliance I used was a microwave and a pressure cooker. I use it everyday to prepare breakfast, lunch and dinner. I purchased a set of Green Pans and they heat the food up perfectly on the stove. MY ONLY REGRET IS THAT I DIDN'T BUY THE TWO BURNER MODEL. I HIGHLY RECOMMENDED THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Kee-Kee

customer_reviews.title: Electric hot plate excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hot plate for a new home move and the gas utilities were not on yet. It’s a terrific product. It heats up fast, usually on 4 then going lower on the setting. It top is flat easy to clean. I used pans or pots close to the width of the plate for more even cooking. About 7.5 inches. It’s great for frying as well as boiling water. It’s a keeper, going on 4 months of use no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Merry Waddell

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t get hot enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with such high hopes. Wanted it in order to fry chicken outdoors and avoid stinking up the house. Well, it couldn’t get a normal sized large frying filled with oil, passed 315 degrees. It took 30 minutes to reach that temperature too. And when food was placed into it, it would plummet to 270, and not come up to 315 for another “10-15” minutes. Unit is just far to underpowered. Maybe fine for frying an egg or making an omelette. But it won’t do well to sear a steak or brown beef.
customer_reviews.author: CaliConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable. Great price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mother. Her stove broke so she is what she used. It’s a great stovetop. Heats fast and holds the temperature. Also boils fast. Mom past so I am using it once in awhile when it’s hot outside and I love it. You will definitely not be disappointed. In the past we got less expensive and they didn’t last long, this has held up for a couple of years now.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We are remodeling part of our house. I have been without a stove going on 62 days. I ran to Walmart and bought a cheap hot plate. Mistake, it would not boil water. I’m cranky, my husband is cranky, we miss real food. There is only so many nights of takeout and cheese and crackers one can endure. Enter the Cuisinart. This has been a life saver! We love it! It boils water!!! And even when our kitchen is done we easily see ourselves using this during dinner parties. Thank you Cuisinart! We love you!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Everything happens at once and good Cuisinart products are wonderful to have at the time.
customer_reviews.text: Fancy refrigerator died at Thanksgiving and still does not work. Fancy stove/oven died before Christmas. No stove, no frig. Got this hot plate and got out old toaster oven and cooked entire huge Christmas dinner with them. Plus microwave. This Cuisinart hot plate worked wonders, and the quality is great. Couldn’t have had Christmas dinner without it. Stove finally was repaired yesterday, so we easily cleaned the Cuisinart up and put away for another day. With our luck, there will be plenty of times we will need to use it, and we are so happy to have it at the ready.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Mericle

customer_reviews.title: good for small pots
customer_reviews.text: first, it takes forever to heat up, and even after it's all the way heat up, you can't really do your every day major cooking on this stove. I use it to make a pack of ramen or two, or make sauce, or keep the food warm after it's cooked on my other stove. I'm using my gas stove for camping instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Realiable heat source
customer_reviews.text: I like the power this hot plate has. The only thing you have to get used to is how long it takes to heat up. It’s not as fast as an electric stove, but once it is hot, it is easily adjusted and it maintains steady heat. So far the performance is as expected. If it would heat up faster, I would give it five stars. But it is sufficient, so it deserves at least four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jpz

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For Small Spaces
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my rv. I do have a gas stove, but at the time of this purchase the weather was cold& my gas went towards heat. I read many reviews before my purchase of the Cuisinart CB-30 Cast Iron single burner. I am very pleased with my purchase and it heats up quickly. This is definitely a keeper for me.
customer_reviews.author: N. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Durable and long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this over the last three months. It isn't going to replace the burner on your stove, but for a stop-gap measure it is fantastic. It does take a while to heat to its top level, but once it is there, boiling and searing and everything else you'd do on a High setting with your stove can be accomplished. It cleans fairly easily and stores well. Lacking a stove for a few months, I've used just this, my Instant Pot and a microwave and really do just fine. Skip the two-burner option because the second burner has such low wattage. Instead you're better off with two of these if you want/need two heat sources.
customer_reviews.author: B C

customer_reviews.title: Solid enough for pressure cooking
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction, easy to use. It got hot enough to get 15.5 quart my pressure cooker to 15 psi. It was sturdy enough to hold that, giant, hot, rumbling pot at temp for over an hour. I've done this several times with no visible melting, warping, or other wear. The price is right, the plate is sturdy. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great for reheating soup.  Iffy for cooking on
customer_reviews.text: Works good. The bottom gets quite warm though. It doesn't heat up like a regular stove. Will take 30-45 on high to boil a big pot of water. Better to heat stuff back up than to actually cook. I use it to reheat dishes for potlucks at work
customer_reviews.author: Cordell Hollins

customer_reviews.title: I have used it 3 times...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for emergencies. I have used it 3 times since purchasing it in August, 2017. It has been kept in its box and in an air conditioned house. It takes 20 minutes to heat to the highest heat and has never reached a boiling point. Just a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron friendly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with beloved cast iron cookware so as not to scratch up glass cooktop in rental. It’s worked just as expected and I like the idea of having it for other situations in the future like camping or having an extra burner for large gatherings (Thanksgiving).
customer_reviews.author: WeeLittleSoul

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like cooking on an electric range which happens to be what I have in the house I just bought. My daughter had one of these and liked it so I gave it a go. It is so much better than my stove I rarely cook on that electric piece of junk any more. This heats evenly which is the big difference. It's solid and well built. Though I still prefer gas, I'm swearing much less while cooking and my meals are coming out better than with the electric stove top.
customer_reviews.author: wbc

customer_reviews.title: A piece of trash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can cook outside in the backyard like deep-frying or to simmer food so my kitchen doesnt get too hot. I've always cleaned it after every use and it still looks like brand new. Today was only the 4th time I was going to use it and it would not turn on/heat up. I wonder if I can get a return or exchange??!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this! I typically stay put in the finished basement, bathroom, bedroom, living room, kitchen set up down here and I was making do with a toaster oven. Boy did I miss tuna melts 😭 I was afraid to use it because I have a big fear of kitchen fires. Nothing about using this made me nervous! Highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Aelahuntress

customer_reviews.title: works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: works like a dream! use it for luncheons....made apple cider and a big pot easily has a rolling boil....used it for big pot of tomato soup no problem at all. love it!
customer_reviews.author: babycakes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Single Burner Electric Cook Top
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit for extra cooking needs. It takes up little counter space and heats up quickly and consistently. I also use this with my generator during power outages, to cook food as needed. It works exceptionally well in these situations. I would recommend this small appliance to anyone needing one of these devices. Very solid and well made. The price for the quality is very fair. Eugene A. Bennett
customer_reviews.author: Eugene A. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy thing to have. It heats up quickly and works great for outdoor cooking. I use it on our deck to cook dishes such as red beans and rice to keep the strong cooking odor out of the house. I’m also going to take it in our RV for easy cooking. It’s also easy to wipe clean.
customer_reviews.author: KarenS50

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long enough to justify the price
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and works well enough -- but not for long. A simple appliance like an electric burner should last for at least 10 years. This one didn’t make it to 2. For warranty repair/replacement, the customer pays for the shipping back to Cuisinart plus $10 “to facilitate the speed and accuracy of your return”. With this product, Cuisinart is cashing in on its brand. And it looks like consumers are on to the fact: the price of this item has dropped significantly in the past two years.
customer_reviews.author: NEILL MASSELLO

customer_reviews.title: I'm on my second one, and both have only lasted 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to get Cuisinart to honor the warranty, but no response yet...
customer_reviews.author: Luke Hunter James-Erickson

customer_reviews.title: But I Love by skillet
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new ceramic top stove and read we weren’t supposed to use cast iron skillets. But I Love by skillet! So I bought this hot plate so I can use it. It works as good as a stove top. Even heating. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brittm03

customer_reviews.title: Only Lasts A few Months - Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. We ordered two and they lasted not even a few months before they stopped working completely. I definitely would not recommend purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: AKT

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST OF BOTH WORLDS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this burner because I wanted enough power to boil a big pot of water for spaghetti - this burner does not deliver unless the lid is on the pot - what is more it is just as bad at the lower end and I wonder what the point is of having all of the number selections on the dial because this thing cooks so very hot at a very low setting - I have to put it way down around (1) to avoid burning food - it's really the worst of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Temperature control works when it wants to work, how it wants to work and IF it wants to work. Can take half an hour to saute something simple; you have to stand there and monitor it because you cannot know what to expect.
customer_reviews.author: napewastewin

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot quick.
customer_reviews.text: Actually I love this thing. It gets hot very quick. A bit of a learning curve on getting it to Simmer. Very touchy on the low end. Had it over a year, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bmag

customer_reviews.title: Solid, works well, predictable heat
customer_reviews.text: Use it at my cabin, *much* more convenient than a camp stove. Electric burners are slow to heat up, slow to cool down, otherwise, this is solid and works well. The temperature range has been what I need, from simmering to frying.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reeves

customer_reviews.title: The Best Thing Ever invented
customer_reviews.text: I like to fry Fish In my House but the smell will keep my House smelling bad for days. no more Stinky fish smelly home I hook it it up out side next to my neighbor patio since they haven't paid there half share of our fence.. it works flawlessly heats up quick fry boil and more Love this !!
customer_reviews.author: ryan bautista

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for a gas stove
customer_reviews.text: My husband is on oxygen 24/7. He has an oxygen generator and walks around the house with a long hose to breathe. We have a gas stove that he cannot use because of the fire danger. With this hot plate he can make a scrambled egg or burger or grilled cheese sandwich without fear of catching the oxygen on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B

customer_reviews.title: Great hot plate , still heating after a year of daily use.
customer_reviews.text: Great little hot plate. I’ve been using in a house I’m renovating & now living in. I still haven’t purchased a stove , so this hot plate gets daily use. Still going strong, heats up pretty quick. My only regret is I wish I had purchased the 2 burner model.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The temperature settings run high. I can NOT simmer or "keep warm" anything. Yet the funny thing is when I want to use my wok & turn it to the highest (5) setting, it doesn't get hot enough. Cuisinart...If you could perfect your temperature settings I would buy many of these. I love the even heat of the cast iron burner & I love that I can use it anywhere I am catering.
customer_reviews.author: elleesse

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. It stopped working all together after a couple uses. Lights won’t turn on anymore, no heat , no click when you turn the temperature dial. Nothing.
customer_reviews.author: James Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic alternative to an el-cheapo crock pot.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic alternative to an el-cheapo crock pot. I like to cook chaga tea and broths for long periods of time, and this is perfect for that. And I can use a nice durable stainless pot on it, instead of the clay crock pots which wear out pretty quickly with extended use. It has a precise, variable temperature control so I can dial it in for a perfect low simmer. Simple and rugged, does exactly what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: Our stove was out for several weeks as we waited for a replacement - we used this instead. I was able to cook meals and boil water. It took a few more minutes to boil water, which wasn't a big deal for us. We weren't cooking gourmet meals on it or anything. It got the job done. We will take this camping!
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: The cast iron burner stays hotter longer than the traditional spiral burners.
customer_reviews.text: The sealed cast iron burner prevents debris from falling into a burner pan like the pans under the spiral burner counter top units. This alone makes it the best counter top I've had. The others got so nasty I threw them away long before they were worn out. Be aware that the cast iron stays hotter longer, but this is free cooking time:)
customer_reviews.author: Brad McHenry

customer_reviews.title: This is GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.text: The heat settings on this is so off!! It can't even leave water at a boil. It burns food on the minimum setting and has inconsistent heat around the burner. DO NOT BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.author: pbj

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: This hot plate is ridiculous except to boil water. Even on the lowest setting frying meat is a joke! It burns everything! Then, stays hot for ever. When I move soon, its going in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Diane H.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a defect product? It was working fine for the first 3 months I bought it, but now it will not heat up. Will still turn on, but will not produce any heat. Wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel haydar

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long.
customer_reviews.text: The burner did fine for what it was. But it stop creating heat pretty quickly. Product did not last 4 months. Completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: Did not work the first time
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because it was a Cuisinart, so thought I would be getting a quality product. I did the prep of turning it on to burn-off any residue and it didn't seem to get very hot. When I next turned it on to actually cook, the lights came on, but it did not heat at all. Returned it and am now looking for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Burner
customer_reviews.text: This is really a very nice and good burner to have, for it heat up evenly and the temperature gets really hot. And it look nice too. I give it a thumb up.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Lee

customer_reviews.title: not for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: used for 14 months. worked perfectly....then nothing. this was a great product, but should last longer, i would think. we plugged in it and it remained on the counter, used regularly as an extra burner to keep food warm or to simmer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Quan

customer_reviews.title: Great for low heat simmering.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have an 18-year-old Viking gas stove, and I could not set it to simmer home-made spaghetti sauce on a low enough flame that it would not burn. This hot plate worked superbly with my 18-quart stock pot. Initially, you have to turn it up to high to burn off some manufacturing chemicals that will smell. The directions say for 5 minutes, but I found it took about 15.
customer_reviews.author: U4IC61

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's great
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. I've used it twice so far and it has gotten the job done. However, when I tried to boil water on max setting it took forever... To the point where I gave up and used the stove instead. It might have been too thick of a pot (KitchenAid stock pot) but a skillet was fine for sauce. Overall it's great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. I needed a burner that maintains temperature for melting chocolate and some light duty items in our chocolate production room. It has a small footprint on the counter, is quiet and efficient. The quiet is great. We had another commercial induction burner and it was so noisy. If you already have other noise in your work space, this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca retired Midwest chef

customer_reviews.title: Slow to heat, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I’m just spoiled with a Natural gas stove, but this thing takes a loooong time to heat up. That being said, it does its job and has been a lifesaver while we’re repairing our kitchen after some water damage. Overall I’m happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kneenuh

customer_reviews.title: Great Product ~ Very Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, it heats up fast, maintains constant temperature settings from simmer to boil. I purchased this because our kitchen is under construction. I use it every day. I will continue to use it even when my kitchen is finished as my range doesn't maintain a simmer. Will also be using it at canning time.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Korson

customer_reviews.title: heat can't vary, stays on high no mater where the dial turns.
customer_reviews.text: This heats up slow and then when you want to reduce the heat to simmer, the heat does not Vary. It stays hot. Once we have our new stove put in this things going to the dump. I hate it. We bought this and an Induction cooktop. That one is perfect. Wish I had bough two of them or returned this.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Bought for water bath process when canning.
customer_reviews.text: Took about 40 minutes to boil a large stock pot Of water for the water bath process when canning. But when reading other reviews I expected it to take a little bit longer. So glad I bought this and didnt try using the glass top stove.
customer_reviews.author: ABC987

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: Great product even though I returned it. It cranked out heat like no other but essentially there was no difference at all between settings so if you need somethinf to stay consistently hot it's a great buy but for the most part the settings are On and off
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great little product
customer_reviews.text: Having a glasstop stove needed a burner that would handle the cast iron pan we use occasionally
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for short-term daily use
customer_reviews.text: Saved my life and sanity during our 2-month kitchen renovation. All the other hotplates on Amazon looked like garbage, and while I am a cheap-o, I decided that it might be worth it to get the Cuisinart one. I do not regret it at all! It works great, basically just as well as the stove top on our old "contractor's special" electric oven. Plus we could always use it in the future for Thanksgiving/Holidays as an extra burner.
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: Lemon vs. Junk Product
customer_reviews.text: Used only 3 times before it stopped working/heating. At that price, I expected a better product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy C Neal Sr

customer_reviews.title: A godsend when I was getting my kitchen remodeled.
customer_reviews.text: I did not have a kitchen for over two weeks due to remodeling. This little burner worked great. It was easy to use and keep clean....and heated up very quickly. I was very pleasantly surprised with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Good for large pots
customer_reviews.text: Nice size. Good for large stock pot. Easy to adjust temperature
customer_reviews.author: Cattie

customer_reviews.title: Here I am 7 months later and let me tell you this works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this back in November because something happened with my stove and I just never bought one. Here I am 7 months later and let me tell you this works like a charm!!! I make all my food with it, it gets to a boiling point so Im able to make rice, fry some chicken, steam vegetables anything you can think of. Ive used it everyday since I had purchased it and it's just amazing. If you thinking about getting one you wont be disappointed its worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart  single burner
customer_reviews.text: I love it ,bought it to use for my pressure cooker not wanting to use my glass top , and ended up using it for cooking many things, I love it already learned to use setting 3 for my pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: CountryLady

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you want to boil or pressure can
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on reviews that said they could use a pressure canner with it. It will not get hot enough raise the pressure AT ALL. Too bad we couldn't return it because we returned home after the return window had closed. Will sell in a garage sale...it's garbage.
customer_reviews.author: pearson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Heats up fast, it’s hard to get it to cool down from a high temperature. And it takes a long time to cool down after it’s off so it just needs to sit on the counter for 10 min or so but it’s a great product when you don’t have a stove top!
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Regular use, still working years later
customer_reviews.text: These things usually burn out. Planned obsolescence. But this one is still going years later with daily use. Heats up fast, reaches high temp, and can hold that temp in cast iron skillet. Easy recommendation. Clean it after you use it, because it'll be around for a while!
customer_reviews.author: Just some dude

customer_reviews.title: The burner is all that it's advertised to be, and then some.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike with the product. It is all that was advertised, neat looking in any kitchen, and easy to operate. Temperatures were right-on, and I consider it a great replacement for my gas stove. I live alone, and the single burner unit fits my simple needs.
customer_reviews.author: Trooper George

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: Would liked to have given this a better review but completely stopped working after 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to do some canning in our outdoor kitchen during the summer, but the large pressure canner never gets hot enough to boil the water to create pressure. Pretty disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: BigBlock

customer_reviews.title: Cover to Boil
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cook/boil outside instead of heating up my kitchen during the summer here in SC (HOT). So far it’s good, but you need to put a lid on the pot to boil. Otherwise, it doesn’t boil.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Hardworking single burner that gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a temp use as we waited for the new stove to get installed. Handsome item. It does take some time to heat up to level 5 which I mostly used, and I find that levels 1 and 2 run hotter than I expected. -- a small matter for me. I fried , boiled water for pasta, sauteed veggies, etc., with excellent results. It will now be put to use heating up water for tea and such in my studio.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Magill

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my studio to cook since I don’t have a full kitchen. Works great. I’ve cooked everything from ramen to beef stew. Doesn’t take much space and even though the oils that splatter can become hard to clean after many uses, it still works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Marie K.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Have a friend that has one of these, and I borrowed it for an outdoor bbq party. Bought one after the party. This is a solid built unit. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: B. KENNEDY

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking just about anything.
customer_reviews.text: This burner has worked perfect for me when cooking my meals at work. It does however take a minute to heat up, but that's the only downside. worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Lanier

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for the 2 days that it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with the burner for the 2 days I used it. Then suddenly it wouldn't turn on, so I will be returning it. I don't know what happened because I followed the care instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Domi

customer_reviews.title: Great electric burner
customer_reviews.text: I took a trip a few months ago and didn't want to take over the stove in the morning while I boiled water for pour over coffee. This thing boils water very quick. It will useful when I need an extra burner or if my stove ever explodes and I need something to cook on temporarily.
customer_reviews.author: gEoFFTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep its heat consistently
customer_reviews.text: Does not heat up like the coil version. And doesn’t maintain the heat.
customer_reviews.author: ElephantLove

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my pressure caner. It takes ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my pressure caner. It takes more time to heat up to temperature, but gets the job done, especially since my caner will not work on my new induction range and I can't seem to find a pressure caner that will.
customer_reviews.author: Sentinel

customer_reviews.title: This portable burner is just awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because my big fancy built in electric stovetop fried out during a power surge (twice). I have now bought 2 of these beauties and have been using them as replacement for the built in stovetop. They work great. This portable burner can boil water - I tried others that could not. Heats up fairly quickly. Easy to clean. Sturdy construction. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Cupcake88

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kitchens with No Stove/Cooktop
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mother's assisted living home with no stove. I love making her a grilled cheese or egg and this little hot plate does the trick. even heat and quick heating make it the perfect accessory for a kitchen without a stove.
customer_reviews.author: Houston Trumpets

customer_reviews.title: Even heat, does a great job. Sturdy. Looks great too
customer_reviews.text: Using this in our kitchenette while remodeling our kitchen. Not as ideal as gas stove of course, but once I got the hang of letting this burner warm up for a few minutes before getting started, all has worked very well. Even heat, does a great job. Sturdy. Looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: mlcreature

customer_reviews.title: i bought 2 - One didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: After several calls with Cuisinart - this became a complete waste of money. The item never worked from day 1 and they would do nothing to help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cook for Thanksgiving when our cooktop was out. Worked as expected. Boiled a full pot of potatoes to serve 12 without issue. Cleans up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Mnjackson
customer_reviews.text: I have the double burner of this unit. I purchased it because my pup likes fresh chicken mixed with her food so I just pop a small skillet and I’m set to go. It’s easier to clean than my glass top stove since I’m using it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Indy

customer_reviews.title: A burner you can count on every time
customer_reviews.text: It is a wonderful product and I would recommend to my family and friends. I like that I am able to use with all of my pans and my little Bialetti coffee maker! This takes a few minutes to heat up to the highest temperature but I still a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Quisinart Single Burner
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice unit. It is a very good one to have in my little kitchen that does not have a stove. I do a lot of cooking on it. In fact, I just ordered another one so that I can have two burners.
customer_reviews.author: C. Paden

customer_reviews.title: so this is perfect, I've got it on top of the gas ...
customer_reviews.text: I went on o2 and can't use the gas stove anymore , so this is perfect , I've got it on top of the gas stove And I use it all the time!! My wife finds it easier to use it too.. GREAT'!!!!!!!!!!!!love it. (I have COPD) don't want to Blow-UP
customer_reviews.author: norma sullivan

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Cast-Iron Single Burner, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Style Name:Cuisinart Single BurnerThe Cuisinart cast-iron single burner adds cooking space to any kitchen - or any place without a kitchen! Its powerful 1300 watts heat up quickly and retain high heat throughout cooking. The "coil-less" Cast iron plate is durable and wipes clean in a snap. Premium brushed Stainless Steel looks elegant in any setting. A 6-setting temperature control offers total flexibility from low to highest heat - use it to keep foods warm, or to cook an entire meal. Ideal for entertaining and holidays when cooking for a crowd. And its compact and portable size make it ideal for small spaces anywhere without a kitchen, such as dorm rooms, boats, patios or RVs. This is a versatile tool that's a great addition to any kitchen - big or small! Features: Brushed stainless steel housing|1300-watt large plate|Adjustable thermostat with On and Ready indicator lights|Heavy-duty cast iron plate|Nonslip rubber feet|Limited One Year Product Warranty
feature_bullets: Heavy-duty cast iron plate for durability. Dimensions : 11.50 L x 11.00 W x 2.50 H inches. UC Weight is 8.20 pounds
Powerful 1300 watts for quick heat-up and heat retention throughout cooking
6-setting adjustable temperature control from low to highest heat

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,386 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
